you know what...even though there were times where i hated the game cuz of loading screens,sometimes awful spawn points and not being able to understand where i am going or wtf is happening around me i still had fun

+vehicles that you can use
+many guns that are cool
+gravity gun but i gotta admit that the end game gravity gun is WAY better than the gravity gun you use at the start of the game
+enemies are cool and interesting
+i always loved G-Man
+Father Grigori !
+Gordon Freeman !
+i gotta admit even though the auto saves sometimes were awful you can still manually save so there is that
-sometimes spawn points can be stupid there was a time where dropships would come and they would drop off enemy troops i killed them and an enemy gunship appeared which i had to kill with rockets and i failed i died then i had to kill everyone that came out of the dropships again cuz the game didnt save after killing the troops that came out of the dropships
-there were times where i was wishing for the game to end i would get bored but that happened while i was in the middle of the campaing at the start and at the end of the campaing i actually had tons of fun

in the end i had more fun then i expected and it was certainly better than the first Half-Life i cant say i hated the first game but this was way better the first one was boring and it got too repetative yes towards the middle of the game it got boring and repetative too just like the first game but this one was just more fun

yep id recommend it i had fun

Great game, but Half-Life 1 is more memorable and satisfying, gameplay wise. Don't expect a part 3 if you know what's good for you.

*** Update 3/16/2019 ***

Game looks a lot better in VR with Vorpx and it also runs smoother. Weapon models look better and there's a lot less graphical glitches than before. The major issue I noticed was that the weapon models do flicker when you move fast and there are frame rate drops here and there. However, the whole experience is much better now playing this in VR. It almost looks like native VR if it weren't for those graphical glitches. Also, you can now customize Vorpx so that you can move your camera up and down with the mouse so you no longer have to choose between mouse-aiming or head-tracking. This is awesome!

You can see my gameplay here in VR: https://youtu.be/MJCbMzd0K2Y

VR Rating 8/10. It's getting close to a 9/10 (only native VR would be better!)

*** Original Review Below ***

[h1] VR Review with 3rd party injector [/h1]

I am not reviewing the game. I will say that for the purposes of my VR review (using Vorpx) that I did play the game extensively in non-VR so that I could have something in my mind to contrast the VR experience with. Obviously, this is a great game and there's a reason some people claim it as one of the best if not the best game ever. I wouldn't go that far, but I do think it was GOTY for it's time back in 2004 for a very good reason and it is a game that is still enjoyeable to play, even today. 

In VR (using Vorpx) this game looks amazing. Somehow, the 3D character details come alive in VR in a way that you really can't notice on a flat screen. In fact, the whole world looks amazing, especially the 3D holograms in-game. The action is fast and frenetic and there's just some breathers in between all the action. All actions feel really good in VR even though you're using a mouse & keyboard. I did turn off head tracking because I prefer to aim with my mouse and not my head. Obviously, this is a compromise, you can turn on head tracking and it'll be easier to look everywhere, at the loss of having to do gaze shooting.

The game itself ran smoothly. However, the visuals do have several glitches that may be impossible to get rid of completely. I turned down resolution. I went 4:3 and I turned down shadows. I think that helped some with the flickering (the starting subway scene in particular had a lot of flickering), but it did not eliminate it completely. I think geometry looks a lot better than z scale so I wouldn't change that. 

I have to admit, I preferred playing this in VR even with the graphical glitches. It looks that good. I was surprised. I didn't think a game this old would translate well to VR. [i][b] [u] Valve has some hidden VR config files in game and there's an Enable VR option in the menu settings. However, I couldn't get that to work. If anybody can, please message me.[/u] [/b] [/i]

VR Rating 7/10.

Todo el suspenso, los desafíos y la carga emocional del half life original, aunados a un realismo sorprendente y una estupenda jugabilidad. Half-Life 2 abre las puertas a un mundo en el que la presencia del jugador influye en todo lo que lo rodea, desde el entorno físico hasta el comportamiento e incluso las emociones de amigos y enemigos. El jugador vuelve a tomar la palanca del científico Gordon Freeman, quien se encuentra en una Tierra infestada por alienígenas, desposeída de todos sus recursos y en la que cada vez queda menos población. Freeman se ve envuelto en el papel nada envidiable de rescatar el mundo del mal que desencadenó en Black Mesa. Y mucha gente a la que aprecia cuenta con él.

Эта игра шедевральна. Сюжет классный, локации продуманы идеально, графика и спецэффекты для меня вторичны, но и это здесь на высоте. Полное погружение в происходящее. На полное прохождение и получение всех достижений ушло 63+ часов. Рекомендую! 10 найденных тайников с лямбдами из 10.
10 комбайнов из 10

A much better game than the original Half Life (and Source port and expansion packs) with dozens of improvements and new concepts alike, which is definitley worth more of its critical claims this time around. Honestly though, this game to me still does feel overhyped as there are some major flaws that piss me off and prevents it from being a "masterpiece" as many of the PC community claim it to be. To be fair, it has aged pretty well and is hell of a lot better than HL1 in pretty much every single way possible, from the graphics and music, to the level design and gunplay, it's a must have for any shooter, puzzle, or PC gaming fan. 

I haven't played Episode 1 and 2 yet but those will be reviewed probably some other time. Anyhow, the story...is actually existant now and the game focuses heavily on plot to progress through the game. Again like its prequel, there are no cutscenes as you experience the scripted events and dialogue first-hand and can have some interaction in most. You don't even need to play the original Half-Life games as HL2 takes place almost 20 years after the first game and occurs in which I think is Eastern Europe. There will be characters that will give you some backstory and lore, and some few references from the first game such as the H.E.V charger module and familiar enemies. 

Just know that the Combine are an alien empire from a parallel universe that has taken over the Earth, enslaved humanity, and it's up to Gordon Freeman to ally with the rebels and vortigaunts (yeah, those electrical shooting aliens) to take them down...or at least the Combine sent to Earth. It kind of sucks that stupid events which I won't spoil prevent the story going as it should be, forcing Freeman to take alternate routes to get to his destinations. Though it's a somewhat justifiable excuse to explore the wilderness and enemy territory, and ofc the game would be beaten in 5-6 hours otherwise. Like I understand things don't always go the way you want to, but if it happens too often then it becomes cliche.

Valve has done it again by blowing away my expectations by having extremely beautiful graphics not only for a 2004 game, but also for a PC game in general. Many of the character and weapon models look good even to this day, and the levels that take advantage of the HDR lighting puts HL2 visually superior or equal to later Valve games like L4D1, Portal, and Team Fortress 2. Even newer games like L4D2 don't have the realistic lighting that HL2 has despite using a newer version of the Source engine. I can't put it into words but let's just say if you were amazed by the lighting in CS:S, then take that and multiply the awesomeness tens of times. 

Expected from such an old game, the textures for the levels and most map props look absolute shit or passable for last decade standards, but viewing it far away and increasing the Anisotropic level helps. Levels that don't have much lighting or HDR at all look ugly due to the "greens, browns, and greys" that are scattered throughout the game's world. I also am not a huge fan of the industrial and Soviet-like setting, but the suburban, wildnerness, and sci-fi sections more than make up for it. Music is less rock 'n roll and techno, moreso atmospheric and of many other genres, while the sound effects are more realistic and satisfying to hear; voice acting is phenomenal and opposite of HL1's shitty voices.

I guess fans have had their voices heard or maybe Valve realized it themselves as the enemies are now less OP and more easier to deal with, except in some levels where they are a pain in the butt. Weapons finally don't suck with accuracy, fire-rate, recoil, and range improved and slightly smaller selection. Combat is much better too as I won't easily take so much damage from enemies and their AI don't feel cheap anymore (hated the HECU somehow having perfect aim with the same guns you use). Half-Life 2 is less focused on action and moreso on exploration and puzzle-solving, with many of the puzzles requiring some knowledge of how physics work in real life.

Difficulty of puzzles is also reduced for the most part, or maybe it's just because they seem easier since I already played the first Half Life? Many of the puzzles won't even seem like puzzles and can blend in with obstacles and props in the environment. Navigation can also be confusing as many paths and rooms will seem very similar and you are truly alone except in some events so no scientists to tell you what to do. Oh, and besides using weapons you can also take control of two vehicles, a hovercraft (or airboat) and a jeep both equipped with a sci-fi turret. Later on in the game, you'll have some members of the Resistance helping you out and even some main characters with decent AI.

Unlike Half-Life, there is no multiplayer included so you'll have to buy HL2: DM separately or as a sale bundle. This time around however, there are achievements that you can get, about half of which are story-related and the other half either easy to get or takes a little effort or scavenging the area. The chapters each take anywhere from 15 minutes to over an hour and a half, with the game in total requiring 15 hours to beat instead of the 10 for HL1. Optimization isn't the best as some areas I got below 60fps, other parts below 90fps, and many times from 150-200fps and up! This game can easily run on any computer that isn't from the 90's so at most just set HL2.exe in compatibility for W7.

Este diria que es de los mejores juegos que se an creado sin duda, desde ecenarios muy bien conatruidos y algunoa persoanjwa muy memorables, es genial jugar a este juego y ver lo bien que a embejesido, la historia esta bien construida y no tiene ningun problema cronológico en la saga, junto con mecanicas que transmiten en tiempo real dan un modo mas real del mundo que estamos viviendo.

Obio tiene problemas como el echo de que por todos lados hay cajad de municiones en lugares a veces sin mucho sentido aunque normalmente funcionan o que la geometria ya esta un poco oxidada para el 2018, los tiempos de cara para vargar cada zona que son relativamente amplias, su funcion ya no es util ya que las pc de ahora lo soportan sin el minimo esfuerzo.

En resumen un gran juego que marco los shooter y perfecciono la formulo de como debe ser un juego de calidad, esperemos que algun dia los desarrolladores de propongan dar un final a esta gran historia echa con yanto empeño y genialidad 10/10
this is the of all time

Same opinion i have about the previous one, maybe i am late to the party but i can’t understand why people praise so much this game, some shooters have aged well, this one haven’t. at least it has several improvements compared to the previous one, the gameplay its better and so are the graphics, and the story, although not as mesmerizing as people would have you believe it’s not so bad and MUCH easier to follow compared to the previous game, still though it’s so convoluted and told in a way as if you should know already everything that its going on, maybe that’s the reason people love it because it makes you feel that you need to read and make theories to understand everything, but i know of so many examples of confusing stories that are told in an understandable way with good writing and storytelling. Finally you have the gameplay which is not very varied just go here shoot things, keep going, so you can’t even say that you didn’t mind the poor story because of strong gameplay, and lastly you have the platforming sections, WHO SAID THAT SHOOTERS AND PLATFORMERS MIX? It just doesn’t work really, most of the times you will be failing because of poor controls. Anyway that’s my opinion, never understood why people praise so much this game and decided to give myself the chance to try it and came out disappointed. 6 out of 10

El mejor trabajo de Valve hasta la fecha, Half-Life 2 es llevar a la perfección una idea que venía de un juego que revolucionó el medio...

G-Man, este misterioso personaje, hace que nuestro trayecto comience. No sin antes soltar una de las frases más icónicas de los videojuegos: "El hombre adecuado en el sitio equivocado puede cambiar el rumbo del mundo".

A partir de aquí comenzamos una larga aventura desde Ciudad 17, lugar que está bajo el total dominio de la Alianza, que todo lo controla.

El salto que hay desde el primer juego está clarisimo desde el primer minuto, desde las físicas ( que ahora se transforman en una mecánica más del juego gracias a la Pistola Anti-gravedad), hasta el increible cambio gráfico .

Nuevos personajes, nuevos giros argumentales y más desastres es lo que ofrece esta segunda entrega de la legendaria saga.
Велоколепная игра!

Half-Life 2 is a fun game to play. The AI is alright, the game teaches you mechanics in a way that is simple and easy to remember, and the storyline is easy to follow.

Now, onto the reason I say the AI is "alright". I put this as my opinion on the AI because the rebels that join your group sometimes block your way and make it so you have to re-attempt going to that area. The only benefits of the squad system is that you get free ammo and medkits.

The weapons are also good, with some even still being viable in the later part of the game- just be prepared for ammo starvation for certain weapons at some points in the game.

All in all, I definitely recommend this game to anyone curious.
